channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The myth that money supply controls inflation is being revived. Here’s how it failed its most ardent believer–Margaret Thatcher
item.description: The myth of a golden monetarist age is being revived decades after the U.K. prime minister's experiment failed.

item.title: Meta slapped with child safety probe under sweeping EU tech law
item.description: Facebook parent company Meta on Thursday was hit with a major investigation from the EU into risks of its platforms to minors.

item.title: Deere's stock slumps as ag machinery maker reports soft guidance
Amazon raised warehouse wages to $15 an hour 5 years ago. Today, half of workers surveyed told researchers they struggle to afford food or rent
item.description: Amazon has long been criticized for its treatment of employees, especially those who pack and ship boxes in its warehouses.

item.title: EasyJet shares fall on profit miss, CEO departure
item.description: Shares of EasyJet fell more than 7% Thursday after the low-cost airline posted a slightly larger than expected pre-tax loss of £350 million.

item.title: GameStop and AMC stock slump in premarket trade on Thursday
Unmarried millennials are twice as likely as boomers to buy homes solo—and 10 times as likely to buy with a friend
item.description: Young buyers are being forced to come up with "creative solutions" to an expensive housing market.

item.title: Thursday's analyst calls: Fast food stock to surge 40%, what to expect from Nvidia earnings
item.description: A fast food stock and Nvidia were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Wall Street.

item.title: Bureau of Labor Statistics said it inadvertently released CPI data early
Rolex seller shares soar after strong U.S. sales—despite it being an 'underdeveloped market'
item.description: Watches of Switzerland Group reported a 14% increase in sales in its fiscal fourth quarter. That helped total sales rise 3% — to $482 million.

item.title: U.S. data fuels bets of Fed rate cuts as early as September — but analysts aren’t convinced
item.description: Traders appear increasingly confident that the U.S. Federal Reserve could start cutting interest rates as early as September.

item.title: Italy government sells $1.49 billion stake in Eni
Florida Gov. DeSantis signs bill banning power-generating wind turbines offshore or near the state’s coastline
item.description: It takes effect July 1 and would also boost expansion of natural gas, reduce regulation on gas pipelines in the state and increase protections against bans on gas appliances such as stoves.

item.title: Microsoft offers relocation to hundreds of China-based AI staff amid U.S.-China tech tensions
item.description: Microsoft has reportedly asked employees at its China-based cloud-computing and artificial-intelligence operations to consider relocation outside of China.

item.title: Siemens to sell Innomotics to KPS Capital Partners for $3.8 billion
